main_point: The professor explains Metal–organic frameworks for gas adsorption and how to interpret evidence when measurements can be misleading.
detail1: The professor distinguishes overpotential (a process) from chemical shift (a proxy/measurement).
detail2: He suggests testing an asymmetric prediction involving spin coupling and photolysis.
attitude: Casual but analytical; he warns against over-trusting a neat correlation.
organization_point: He adds a tangent about a conference anecdote to show real-world constraints.
connecting_point: The example about controlling for polydispersity shows how bias can flip an apparent pattern.
